attributes.action: Right to charge electric cars around the living area with household price
attributes.additional_details:
Household owners should be able to charge their vehicles at household prices. We need this law to avoid a lot of cables from extension cords running from households to charge electric cars. 
Charging at the price of the household should be 4.5 kW, if more power is needed, then the owners of electric cars will pay a higher price, but the minimum price should be available to every owner of an electric car near his living area.
attributes.background: Create a law, which will regulate the pricing policy of charging station operators in the living area. This law should protect the rights of electric car owners who want to charge their cars near the house and should not fall under the influence of charging operators.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We're not sure what you mean by "living area" and whether you want EV charging to be the same as individual household bills or set at a specific rate for all users. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. 

If you decide to start a new petition, you'll need to use your full name.
